properties.name: Herberger Theater Center
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity 222 E Monroe PhoenixThe Herberger Theater Center was conceived as a pivotal piece in the redevelopment and revitalization of downtown Phoenix. Built in 1989 to support and foster the growth of performing arts in Phoenix as a performance venue and arts incubator, the Herberger Theater Center has contributed to the cultural and educational development of the Valley. Each year, approximately 175,000 patrons, including 30,000 school-aged children share the unique experience of live performing arts.

properties.name: Matador
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity 125 E. Adams Phoenix, AZ 85004We are well known for our frothy margaritas, our delicious Mexican entrees and our "Greek Taco\'s". Everything in Matadors is made fresh daily. Nothing comes from a can and there are no preservatives. Our salsa, hot sauce, guacamole, tamales and everything else is homemade. The tacos are made from shredded beef, not ground meat. We even make our own Menudo with tripe, beef feet (patas), hominy, corn and spices. Popular dishes include our Huevos Rancheros, Lengua Con Chili and our Beef Tougue in Green Sauce. Come by on Wednesday or Sunday to enjoy our Mexican stew called Cocido. When you do visit us make sure not to try one of our fantastic desserts including our deep-fried marble cheesecake.

properties.name: Orpheum Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity Phoenix, AZ 85003-1602Orpheum Theatre has been renovated for "adaptive reuse," restoring as much of its visible splendor as possible, while retrofitting it as a modern theatre capable of handling anything Broadway sends its way. And its marquee at Second Avenue and Adams Street again announces the names of first class productions, drawing thousands of people to a vibrant downtown venue.

properties.name: Phoenix Children's Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity  1919 East Thomas Road Phoenix, AZ 85016Phoenix Children\'s Hospital has provided hope, healing, and the best healthcare for children and families since it was born 25 years ago. Today, Phoenix Children\'s is one of the ten largest children\'s hospitals in the country and provides specialty and sub-specialty inpatient, outpatient, and emergency care to patients throughout Arizona and other Southwestern states.

properties.name: Phoenix Community Kollel
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity 6516 N. 7th St. #104 Phoenix, AZ 85014The Phoenix Community Kollel is an independent institute for advanced Jewish studies located in North Central Phoenix, dedicated to providing superior educational opportunities for the Valley Jewish community. Created to offer Jewish learning that transcends the classroom, its dynamic faculty offers tools to connect timeless Jewish traditions with modern life. With over 100 years of Torah Scholarship between them, the Kollel Rabbis seek to unite the communty in the common pursuit of Jewish vibrancy through Torah learning The Kollel is an independent non-profit 501 (c) 3 Arizona Corporation supported by Gifts of Jewish Unity made by local benefactors who share our vision of lifelong Torah learning for every Jew. All contributions are tax-deductible.

properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity 10410 N 32ND ST PHOENIX, AZ 85028Our goal is to provide you with great service and high-quality workmanship at a fair price. Our prices are low, and our quality of repair is second to none. We consider our ethics more important than anything else. We will NEVER sell you work you don\'t need, and we will never pressure you to buy anything. Ever. We want you as a customer for life, we mean it and we will work for it. properties.name: Symphony Hall
properties.description: Posted by Mymicrocity 75 North Second Street, Phoenix, AZ 85004Since the doors to Symphony Hall first opened in 1972, millions of people have crossed the venue\'s welcoming threshold into a cultural and performance icon integral to the Valley\'s arts landscape. It\'s now a new era for this very-popular venue with the recent completion of an extensive 8.5 million renovation and expansion. The multi-purpose Symphony Hall, home to The Phoenix Symphony, Arizona Opera and Ballet Arizona. is also the site for Broadway touring companies, a variety of dance productions, and appearances by popular entertainers, as well as the location for business seminars, and convention general sessions.
